title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 2.

questions.question: What did Solomon determine to build according to 2 Chronicles 2:1?
options: An house for the name of the LORD and an house for his kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: An house for the name of the LORD and an house for his kingdom
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:1 states that Solomon determined to build a house for the name of the LORD, and an house for his kingdom.

questions.question: How many men did Solomon tell out to bear burdens as per 2 Chronicles 2:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Seventy thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:2 says Solomon told out threescore and ten thousand men to bear burdens, which is seventy thousand.

questions.question: To whom did Solomon send a message asking for cedars and skilled workers, as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 2:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Huram the king of Tyre
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:3 states that Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre requesting help for the building project.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the house Solomon planned to build according to 2 Chronicles 2:4?
options: To dedicate it to the LORD and burn incense, shewbread, and burnt offerings
To use as a royal palace
To serve as a fortress against enemies
questions.correctAnswer: To dedicate it to the LORD and burn incense, shewbread, and burnt offerings
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:4 explains that Solomon’s house was to be dedicated to the LORD for burning incense, shewbread, and burnt offerings continually.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 2:5, why is the house Solomon builds considered great?
options: Because great is our God above all gods
Because it is made of gold
Because it is the tallest building
Because it is built on a mountain
questions.correctAnswer: Because great is our God above all gods
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:5 states the house is great because great is our God above all gods.

questions.question: Who did Solomon request to be sent to help work with gold, silver, brass, and other materials in 2 Chronicles 2:7?
options: A man cunning to work in various crafts
questions.correctAnswer: A man cunning to work in various crafts
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:7 says Solomon asked for a man skilled in gold, silver, brass, iron, and other materials to assist him.

questions.question: From where did Solomon request cedar, fir, and algum trees for timber as per 2 Chronicles 2:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Lebanon
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:8 specifies Solomon asked for timber from Lebanon.

questions.question: What did Solomon offer to Huram's servants for cutting timber, according to 2 Chronicles 2:10?
options: Beaten wheat, barley, wine, and oil
questions.correctAnswer: Beaten wheat, barley, wine, and oil
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:10 describes Solomon’s offer of twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, barley, wine, and oil to Huram's servants.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 2:6, Solomon acknowledged that even heaven of heavens cannot contain God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:6 states that heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain God, showing Solomon's humility.

questions.question: Who did Huram send to assist Solomon as stated in 2 Chronicles 2:13?
options: A cunning man endued with understanding
questions.correctAnswer: A cunning man endued with understanding
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:13 mentions Huram sent a skilled and understanding man to help Solomon.

questions.question: What was the ancestry of the skilled man Huram sent, according to 2 Chronicles 2:14?
options: Son of a woman of the daughters of Dan and father was a man of Tyre
questions.correctAnswer: Son of a woman of the daughters of Dan and father was a man of Tyre
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:14 identifies the skilled man as the son of a woman from Dan and a father from Tyre.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Chronicles 2:16 says the wood from Lebanon would be brought to Jerusalem by land only.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:16 states the wood would be brought by sea to Joppa and then carried up to Jerusalem, not only by land.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 2 Chronicles 2:17: 'And Solomon numbered all the ______ that were in the land of Israel.'
questions.correctAnswer: strangers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:17 records Solomon numbering all the strangers in the land of Israel.

questions.question: How many overseers did Solomon set over the workers according to 2 Chronicles 2:18?
questions.correctAnswer: Three thousand six hundred
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:18 mentions Solomon appointed three thousand six hundred overseers to oversee the work.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Chronicles 2:12, Huram praises the LORD God of Israel for giving David a wise son to build the house.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:12 shows Huram blessing the LORD for giving David a wise and understanding son, Solomon.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is feeling inadequate for a big task in ministry. Based on 2 Chronicles 2:6, what biblical truth would you share about humility and dependence on God?
options: God is too great to be contained, so we build for His glory, not to contain Him
We must rely solely on our own strength and wisdom
God expects us to accomplish everything perfectly on our own
Building a temple means God becomes limited by our work
questions.correctAnswer: God is too great to be contained, so we build for His glory, not to contain Him
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:6 teaches that no one can build a house to contain God, as 'heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain him.' This shows we act in humility, offering service and worship rather than trying to limit God. This encourages humility and dependence on God’s greatness.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s request for skilled workers in 2 Chronicles 2:7-8 teach us about the importance of using God-given talents in service to Him?
options: God honors the wise use of talents to glorify Him in service
Talents should be hidden and not shared with others
Only physical strength matters, not skills or wisdom
Talents are irrelevant in spiritual work
questions.correctAnswer: God honors the wise use of talents to glorify Him in service
questions.explanation: Solomon asks for workers skilled in various crafts (2 Chronicles 2:7-8), showing that talents and skills are gifts from God to be used wisely in His service, reflecting faithfulness and stewardship in work.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with perseverance in a long-term project. Based on 2 Chronicles 2:2 and 2 Chronicles 2:18, what biblical principle about work ethic and leadership would you encourage them with?
options: Perseverance and good organization lead to fulfilling God’s purposes effectively
Work should be avoided if it becomes too difficult
Only leaders should work hard, others can be passive
God does not care about how we manage tasks
questions.correctAnswer: Perseverance and good organization lead to fulfilling God’s purposes effectively
questions.explanation: Solomon organized large numbers of workers with overseers (2 Chronicles 2:2,18), demonstrating that perseverance combined with wise leadership and work ethic is vital in accomplishing God’s work.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s willingness to cooperate with Huram, king of Tyre, in 2 Chronicles 2:3-4 demonstrate biblical principles of fellowship and partnership in ministry?
options: God honors unity and cooperation among believers to accomplish His purposes
We should never accept help from others
Ministry can only be done alone without partnerships
Partnerships are distractions from God’s work
questions.correctAnswer: God honors unity and cooperation among believers to accomplish His purposes
questions.explanation: Solomon’s request to Huram (2 Chronicles 2:3-4) shows the importance of working together with others who share God’s vision, teaching us to value fellowship and partnership in ministry.

questions.question: A believer is considering dedicating their work to God. How does 2 Chronicles 2:4 teach about dedicating daily tasks as an act of worship?
options: Dedicating work to God is an eternal ordinance and act of worship
Work is separate from worship and has no spiritual value
Only church activities can be dedicated to God
Worship is only about singing and praying, not work
questions.correctAnswer: Dedicating work to God is an eternal ordinance and act of worship
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:4 states Solomon builds the house to dedicate it to the Lord for continual offerings, teaching that dedicating work and life to God is a form of worship and obedience.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 2:5, Solomon acknowledges that God is greater than all other gods, teaching us to have faith and trust in the one true God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:5 affirms, ‘great is our God above all gods,’ encouraging believers to trust fully in God’s supremacy and faithfulness.

questions.question: How can Solomon’s provision of food and drink to the workers in 2 Chronicles 2:10 teach us about biblical generosity and stewardship in supporting others’ service?
options: Supporting workers’ needs reflects generosity and stewardship in God’s work
Workers must provide for themselves without help
Generosity is only for the wealthy
Stewardship does not involve caring for others’ practical needs
questions.correctAnswer: Supporting workers’ needs reflects generosity and stewardship in God’s work
questions.explanation: Solomon promises wheat, barley, wine, and oil to the workers (2 Chronicles 2:10), showing that providing for those who serve is a biblical act of generosity and stewardship.

questions.question: Based on 2 Chronicles 2:12, how does God’s gift of wisdom to Solomon encourage believers in prayer and seeking God’s guidance for their responsibilities?
options: God grants wisdom to those who seek Him for their tasks
Wisdom is only natural and not from God
We should rely on human knowledge alone
Prayers are unnecessary for decision making
questions.correctAnswer: God grants wisdom to those who seek Him for their tasks
questions.explanation: Huram blesses God for giving Solomon wisdom and understanding (2 Chronicles 2:12), teaching believers to seek God’s guidance and wisdom through prayer in all responsibilities.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon’s numbering of strangers in Israel in 2 Chronicles 2:17 and 2 Chronicles 2:18 shows an example of careful planning and accountability in God’s work.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Solomon’s census and organization of workers (2 Chronicles 2:17-18) demonstrate that responsible planning and accountability are important in fulfilling God’s purposes effectively.

questions.question: How does Huram’s sending of a skilled craftsman in 2 Chronicles 2:13-14 teach us about recognizing and using gifted individuals in the church community?
options: God provides gifted people to help in His work, and we should appreciate and utilize their talents
Each person should work alone without collaboration
Spiritual gifts are unimportant in practical ministry
Only kings and leaders have valuable skills
questions.correctAnswer: God provides gifted people to help in His work, and we should appreciate and utilize their talents
questions.explanation: Huram sends a skilled craftsman to assist Solomon (2 Chronicles 2:13-14), illustrating that God equips the community with gifted individuals to serve together.

questions.question: A believer feels overwhelmed by the scale of God’s work. Based on 2 Chronicles 2:9, what biblical truth about God’s greatness and our role would you share?
options: God’s work is great and wonderful, and we are part of something bigger than ourselves
God’s work should be small and manageable only
We should avoid large tasks because they are impossible
Only kings can participate in God’s great works
questions.correctAnswer: God’s work is great and wonderful, and we are part of something bigger than ourselves
questions.explanation: Solomon acknowledges the house to be built will be ‘wonderful great’ (2 Chronicles 2:9), reminding believers that God’s work is grand and we are called to participate faithfully regardless of scale.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon said, 'I build an house to the name of the LORD my God, to dedicate it to him, and to burn before him sweet _______, and for the continual shewbread.'
questions.correctAnswer: incense
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:4 mentions burning sweet incense before the Lord as part of dedicating the house to God’s service.

questions.question: How can the example of Solomon’s prayerful request to Huram in 2 Chronicles 2:3 encourage believers to practice prayer and trust when undertaking important work?
options: Praying and trusting God to provide resources is essential for faithful service
We should act without seeking God’s help
Prayer is only for personal needs, not work projects
God does not involve Himself in practical matters
questions.correctAnswer: Praying and trusting God to provide resources is essential for faithful service
questions.explanation: Solomon’s letter to Huram asking for help (2 Chronicles 2:3) models dependence on God through prayer and trust when preparing for significant tasks.

questions.question: What biblical virtue is demonstrated by Solomon’s careful appointment of overseers in 2 Chronicles 2:2 and 2 Chronicles 2:18?
options: Leadership and stewardship in organizing God’s work
Relying only on self without guidance
questions.correctAnswer: Leadership and stewardship in organizing God’s work
questions.explanation: Solomon’s appointment of overseers (2 Chronicles 2:2,18) exemplifies godly leadership and stewardship, ensuring work is done orderly and effectively for God’s glory.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s recognition of God’s supremacy in 2 Chronicles 2:5-6 teach us about humility and worship in daily life?
options: Acknowledging God’s greatness leads to humble service and reverence
We should boast about our achievements instead of God
God is limited by human actions
Worship is optional and not important
questions.correctAnswer: Acknowledging God’s greatness leads to humble service and reverence
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:5-6 shows Solomon’s humility before God’s greatness, teaching believers to worship with reverence and serve humbly in recognition of God’s supremacy.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 2.

questions.question: What was Solomon’s primary purpose in determining to build a house, according to 2 Chronicles 2:1?
options: To establish a center for his kingdom and honor the LORD
To create a palace for his own residence
To build a fortress against enemies
To construct a marketplace for trade
questions.correctAnswer: To establish a center for his kingdom and honor the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:1 states Solomon determined to build a house 'for the name of the LORD, and an house for his kingdom,' showing both religious and political intent.

questions.question: How many men did Solomon assign to bear burdens in the building project?
questions.correctAnswer: Seventy thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:2 specifies Solomon told out 'threescore and ten thousand men' (70,000) to bear burdens.

questions.question: To whom did Solomon send a message requesting assistance and materials for the temple, as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 2:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Huram, king of Tyre
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 2:3 clearly states Solomon sent to Huram, king of Tyre, requesting help as was given to David.

questions.question: What specific religious practices did Solomon intend the temple to support, according to 2 Chronicles 2:4?
options: Burning sweet incense, continual shewbread, and burnt offerings on sabbaths and new moons
Sacrificing animals only on the Day of Atonement
Holding weekly festivals for the king
questions.correctAnswer: Burning sweet incense, continual shewbread, and burnt offerings on sabbaths and new moons
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:4 details Solomon’s intent for the temple to serve for incense, shewbread, and burnt offerings regularly on sabbaths, new moons, and festivals.

questions.question: What theological challenge does Solomon express about building a house for God in 2 Chronicles 2:6?
options: He acknowledges that heaven cannot contain God, so the house is symbolic
He believes the house will be the literal dwelling of God
He wants to build a house for his own glory
questions.correctAnswer: He acknowledges that heaven cannot contain God, so the house is symbolic
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:6 reveals Solomon’s humility, recognizing that 'heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain him,' thus the temple is not God’s full dwelling but a place for sacrifice.

questions.question: Which craftsman skill did Solomon specifically request from Huram in 2 Chronicles 2:7?
options: Skill in gold, silver, brass, iron, purple, crimson, blue, and engraving
Skill in farming and animal husbandry
Skill in building walls and fortifications
questions.correctAnswer: Skill in gold, silver, brass, iron, purple, crimson, blue, and engraving
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 2:7 shows Solomon's request for a master craftsman skilled in precious metals, dyes, and engraving to work alongside Judah’s men.

questions.question: What types of trees did Solomon request from Lebanon for the temple construction (2 Chronicles 2:8)?
questions.correctAnswer: Cedar, fir, and algum trees
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:8 specifies Solomon asked for cedar, fir, and algum trees from Lebanon, highlighting the importance of high-quality timber.

questions.question: How did Solomon plan to compensate Huram's servants who would cut timber, as stated in 2 Chronicles 2:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Wheat, barley, wine, and oil
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:10 details Solomon’s offer of twenty thousand measures each of wheat, barley, baths of wine and oil to Huram’s laborers.

questions.question: What reason does Huram give for blessing Solomon in his letter to him (2 Chronicles 2:11-12)?
options: Because the LORD loved His people and made Solomon king
Because Solomon was wealthy and powerful
Because Solomon was a skilled warrior
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD loved His people and made Solomon king
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Chronicles 2:11-12 explain Huram's blessing is rooted in the LORD's love for Israel and granting Solomon wisdom to build the house.

questions.question: Who was the skilled craftsman sent by Huram to assist Solomon, as described in 2 Chronicles 2:13-14?
options: A man, son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, father a man of Tyre
questions.correctAnswer: A man, son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, father a man of Tyre
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:13-14 describes the craftsman as of mixed heritage, skilled in numerous crafts, sent by Huram to work with Solomon's men.

questions.question: In 2 Chronicles 2:16, how was the timber from Lebanon to be transported to Jerusalem?
options: By floats on the sea to Joppa, then carried up to Jerusalem
By river barges along the Jordan River
By camel trains directly to Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: By floats on the sea to Joppa, then carried up to Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 2:16 details the logistical plan using sea floats to Joppa and then land transport to Jerusalem, reflecting ancient Near Eastern trade methods.

questions.question: What was the total number of strangers in Israel counted by Solomon, as recorded in 2 Chronicles 2:17?
options: One hundred fifty thousand and three thousand six hundred
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred fifty thousand and three thousand six hundred
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:17 states Solomon counted 'an hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred' strangers, indicating a large labor force.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon’s workforce was divided into bearers of burdens, hewers of stone, and overseers in equal numbers.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:18 shows differing numbers: 70,000 bearers, 80,000 hewers, and 3,600 overseers, not equal.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon’s request to Huram included a man skilled in _______ to work alongside his own craftsmen (2 Chronicles 2:7).
options: gold, silver, brass, iron, purple, crimson, and blue
questions.correctAnswer: gold, silver, brass, iron, purple, crimson, and blue
questions.explanation: The verse 2 Chronicles 2:7 highlights Solomon’s request for a craftsman skilled in precious metals and dyes to collaborate with Judah’s men.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s humility in 2 Chronicles 2:6 foreshadow New Testament teachings about God’s dwelling?
options: It anticipates the idea that God dwells in believers, not in buildings
It rejects the notion of God’s presence on earth
It claims God only dwells in heaven
questions.correctAnswer: It anticipates the idea that God dwells in believers, not in buildings
questions.explanation: Solomon’s recognition that heaven cannot contain God (2 Chronicles 2:6) foreshadows New Testament teaching (e.g., 1 Corinthians 3:16) that God dwells within believers rather than physical temples.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was Solomon's primary purpose in building the house mentioned in 2 Chronicles 2?
options: To honor the name of the LORD and establish his kingdom
To create a palace for himself
To build a fortress against enemies
To build a marketplace for trade
questions.correctAnswer: To honor the name of the LORD and establish his kingdom
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:1 states Solomon determined to build a house for the name of the LORD and an house for his kingdom. This reflects the theological principle of honoring God’s name and establishing His kingdom, consistent with Exodus 25:8, Psalm 29:2, 1 Kings 8:29, and John 18:36 where God's kingdom and name are central.

questions.question: How many men did Solomon assign to bear burdens for the construction?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:2 specifies Solomon told out threescore and ten thousand men (70,000) to bear burdens. This highlights the organizational preparation for God’s house, paralleling Nehemiah 3:1 and Exodus 1:14 where labor is assigned for God’s work.

questions.question: What role did the 3,600 men have in the building project?
options: They were overseers of the workers
questions.correctAnswer: They were overseers of the workers
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 2:2 and 2:18, 3,600 men were appointed to oversee the laborers. This role of supervision is critical in fulfilling God’s order, similar to the overseers in Exodus 38:21 and Nehemiah 3:32.

questions.question: Who was the king of Tyre that Solomon sent a message to for assistance?
questions.correctAnswer: Huram
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:3 mentions Solomon sent to Huram, king of Tyre. This alliance reflects God's providence in using Gentile rulers to assist His purposes, consistent with 1 Kings 5:1 and Isaiah 45:1 regarding God raising up leaders.

questions.question: According to Solomon, why is building a house for God a humbling task?
options: Because heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain Him
questions.correctAnswer: Because heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain Him
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:6 reflects Solomon’s understanding that God’s infinite presence cannot be confined to a temple. This theological truth appears in 1 Kings 8:27, Isaiah 66:1, Psalm 139:7-10, and Acts 7:48-50 emphasizing God's transcendence.

questions.question: What kind of craftsmen did Solomon request from Huram?
options: A man skilled in gold, silver, brass, iron, purple, crimson, and blue, with skill to engrave
A man skilled in pottery and weaving
A man skilled in farming and fishing
A man skilled in military strategy
questions.correctAnswer: A man skilled in gold, silver, brass, iron, purple, crimson, and blue, with skill to engrave
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:7 shows Solomon’s request for a multi-skilled craftsman to work with precious materials and intricate engraving. This craftsmanship honors God’s glory, paralleling Exodus 31:3-5, 1 Kings 7:13-14, and Revelation 21:18-21.

questions.question: What trees did Solomon specifically ask for to be cut from Lebanon?
questions.correctAnswer: Cedar, fir, and algum
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:8 records Solomon’s request for cedar, fir, and algum trees from Lebanon. These trees symbolize strength and beauty in temple construction, echoing 1 Kings 5:6, Psalm 92:12, and Ezekiel 31:3.

questions.question: What was Solomon’s offer to the workers who cut the timber?
options: 20,000 measures of wheat, barley, wine, and oil each
questions.correctAnswer: 20,000 measures of wheat, barley, wine, and oil each
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:10 reveals Solomon’s generous provision of food and drink for the timber workers. This reflects God’s provision theme in Deuteronomy 28:12, Nehemiah 5:18, 1 Timothy 5:18, and Philippians 4:19.

questions.question: How did Huram, king of Tyre, describe Solomon in his written answer?
options: A wise son, endued with prudence and understanding
questions.correctAnswer: A wise son, endued with prudence and understanding
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:12 praises Solomon’s wisdom and prudence as God’s gift to build the house. This aligns with 1 Kings 3:12, James 1:5, Proverbs 2:6, and Colossians 1:9 highlighting divine wisdom.

questions.question: What was the lineage of the skilled craftsman sent by Huram?
options: Son of a woman of the daughters of Dan and a man of Tyre
questions.correctAnswer: Son of a woman of the daughters of Dan and a man of Tyre
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:14 identifies the craftsman’s mixed heritage, symbolizing God's use of diverse peoples for His work, consistent with Ruth 1:16-17, Acts 10:34-35, Galatians 3:28, and Ephesians 2:14.

questions.question: How was the timber to be transported from Lebanon to Jerusalem?
options: By sea to Joppa and then carried up to Jerusalem
By land caravans directly to Jerusalem
By river boats to the Jordan River
questions.correctAnswer: By sea to Joppa and then carried up to Jerusalem
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:16 describes the timber being brought in floats by sea to Joppa, then carried to Jerusalem, illustrating God’s providential logistics, akin to Ezra 3:7 and Acts 27:17.

questions.question: What was the total number of strangers in Israel according to Solomon's numbering?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:17 records the number of strangers as one hundred fifty thousand three hundred and sixty (150,360), indicating God’s inclusion of foreigners in His covenant community, consistent with Leviticus 19:33-34, Exodus 12:49, and Ephesians 2:19.

questions.question: What does Solomon acknowledge as the only reason for building the house for God?
questions.correctAnswer: To burn sacrifice before Him
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:6 shows Solomon humbly recognizing that no house can contain God; the temple’s purpose is for sacrifices to honor Him. This reflects Hebrews 10:1-4, Leviticus 1, Psalm 51:16-17, and John 4:23-24 on true worship.

questions.question: What attributes of God are emphasized by Solomon when he says 'great is our God above all gods'?
options: God's supremacy and sovereignty over false gods
questions.correctAnswer: God's supremacy and sovereignty over false gods
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 2:5 affirms God’s greatness above all gods, emphasizing His supremacy and sovereignty. This doctrine is foundational, supported by Isaiah 45:5, Exodus 15:11, Psalm 95:3, and 1 Corinthians 8:6.

questions.question: What theological principle can be derived from Solomon’s collaboration with Huram and the foreigners in building the temple?
options: God uses Gentiles to fulfill His redemptive purposes
Only Israelites are allowed to work on holy projects
The temple was a strictly local endeavor
Foreigners were excluded from all religious work
questions.correctAnswer: God uses Gentiles to fulfill His redemptive purposes
questions.explanation: The cooperation between Solomon and Huram (2 Chronicles 2:3-14) illustrates God’s providence in using Gentiles for His plans, echoed in Isaiah 49:6, Acts 10:34-35, Romans 11:11-12, and Revelation 7:9.
